info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 15 at 2:32AM CST until December 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Very windy, warm, and dry conditions expected today... .An upper level storm system will move into the Central Plains today, bringing strong southwest winds with it. Many locations may experience wind gusts over 45 mph by this afternoon, with stronger gusts perhaps briefly exceeding 70 mph across far northwestern Oklahoma. Well above average temperatures and minimum relative humidity in the low teens will also be present, resulting in Critical to Extreme fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND WARM TEMPERATURES FOR MOST OF WESTERN OKLAHOMA AND HARDEMAN COUNTY TEXAS... * TIMING...Late morning through early evening. * WINDS...Southwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 13 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Mid 70s to lower 80s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that start in this environment will become very difficult to control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures will contribute to extreme fire behavior.
